parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Second; with the article: in the second place, for the second time. As the compare of duo; second.
Simon. Of Hebrew origin; Simon, the name of nine Israelites.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Yes, certainly, even so. A primary particle of strong affirmation; yes.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

str2: From philos; to be a friend to (an individual or an object), i.e. Have affection for; specially, to kiss.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To shepherd, tend, herd; hence: I rule, govern. From poimen; to tend as a shepherd of.

A sheep. Probably neuter of a presumed derivative of probaino; something that walks forward, i.e., a sheep.
